Tucson holds Talon gently with an arm around her shoulders.  He looks up an=
d then back to her.

" Like a branch on a tree that has broken off during a=
 storm and regrows in a different direction than it had been, before it had=
 broken off.  I know exactly how you feel.  I feel the same way.   At one t=
ime, I was blind, rolled on four wheels and I always seemed to be an Autobo=
t rebel.  I fought along side with my comrades but I wasn't good at followi=
ng orders.  I was well grounded but lost at the same time.  Then, I met you=
 and things began to change on a more positive note.  You may not believe t=
his, but you helped me to find my path, and you saw me on the right road an=
d guided me to my true fate.  Soon afterwards, I became a Prime, acquired s=
eventeen more wheels, and almost looked like Optimus Prime, yet different. =
 But one thing didn't change, I was still battling blindness off and on.  T=
hen, a third change, due to extensive damage to my previous form, which cou=
ld not be repaired, I was guided to my final evolution, this one.  All of t=
hese things wouldn't have come about if I had never met you.  And I wouldn'=
t have it any other way.  Talon, I will miss this planet as much as you are=
, and hopefully we can tell our offspring all about this planet and it's wo=
ndrous varieties of life that live here."

The rodent climbs down and drops=
 a nut into his hand, and chatters to him.

" This is for us to keep?  Than=
k you, we will take good care of it."

He places the nut in Talon's hand.

=
" I think we have a way to bring back a small reminder of this planet.  Let=
's see if we can encourage it to grow on ours."

Local artist who specializ=
es in illustration, using traditional and digital media.  

I also speciali=
ze in hand made crafts.  Great for any occasion!

> > > > With a happy look on his fa=
ce, Tucson walks with Talon, down the corridor and out to a walking trail w=
hich he had been down before but could not see. It was leading to the old d=
ragon's cave. But the path itself carries a serene atmosphere as a gentile =
stream ripples over glistening river rocks while dragonflies dodge the curr=
ent of the water. And now, for the first time, Tucson could actually enjoy =
it visually as well as harmonically. 
> > > > 
> > > > " I've been this way=
 once before, but I wanted to return here when it was possible for both of =
us to enjoy it together. And now, we can. I can see why Leo is concerned, s=
o much innocent life, too valuable to destroy. The entire planet is a treas=
ure within itself. And who better to enjoy this treasure than with you? No =
one. I only hope that after we leave, this world will remain as pure as it =
is now. But there's more that I want to show you."
> > > > 
> > > > He take=
s Talon into a forest of giant trees and points upward.
> > > > 
> > > > " =
If you sit under this tree and look straight up, it appears to be reaching =
to the sky, yet it shades you from the heat of the sun. It provides shelter=
 and protection, yet it does so in an innocent manner. It's something Maste=
r Yoketron taught me, when he was my Sensai. See things with a different pe=
rspective and not always what everyone else sees. Here, I'll show you. "
> =
> > > 
> > > > He shows Talon to a boulder beneath a large hardwood tree an=
d sits right under it,looking up.
> > > > 
> > > > " If you sit right here =
beside me and look up, you'll see what I mean."

<html><head></head><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Tucson holds Talon gently=
 with an arm around her shoulders.  He looks up and then back to her.<=
/div><div><br></div><div>" Like a branch on a tree that has broken off duri=
ng a storm and regrows in a different direction than it had been, before it=
 had broken off.  I know exactly how you feel.  I feel the same w=
ay.   At one time, I was blind, rolled on four wheels and I always see=
med to be an Autobot rebel.  I fought along side with my comrades but =
I wasn't good at following orders.  I was well grounded but lost at th=
e same time.  Then, I met you and things began to change on a more pos=
itive note.  You may not believe this, but you helped me to find my pa=
th, and you saw me on the right road and guided me to my true fate.  S=
oon afterwards, I became a Prime, acquired seventeen more wheels, and almos=
t looked like Optimus Prime, yet different.  But one thing didn't chan=
ge, I was still battling blindness off and on.  Then, a third change, =
due to extensive damage to my previous form, which could not be repaired, I=
 was guided to my final evolution, this one.  All of these things woul=
dn't have come about if I had never met you.  And I wouldn't have it a=
ny other way.  Talon, I will miss this planet as much as you are, and =
hopefully we can tell our offspring all about this planet and it's wondrous=
 varieties of life that live here."</div><div><br></div><div>The rodent cli=
mbs down and drops a nut into his hand, and chatters to him.</div><div><br>=
</div><div>" This is for us to keep?  Thank you, we will take good car=
e of it."</div><div><br></div><div>He places the nut in Talon's hand.</div>=
<div><br></div><div>" I think we have a way to bring back a small reminder =
of this planet.  Let's see if we can encourage it to grow on ours."<br=
><br>Local artist who specializes in illustration, using traditional and di=
gital media.  <div><br></div><div>I also specialize in hand made craft=
s.  Great for any occasion!  </div><div><br></div><div>Need a gre=
at gift idea that is original?  No problem!  Email me at this add=
ress and we will talk.  </div></div><div><br>On Jun 16, 2012, at 11:12=
 PM, "C" <<a href=3D"mailto:airly2002@...">airly2002@...=
</a>> wrote:<br><br></div><div></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>

p-text">

ch" sighed Talon "it's weird to say that because... Taking in count what I =
was... Its funny the turns that life has"<br>

huckles and gives the nut back to the rodent.<br>
> <br>

ped this."<br>

n, I'm going to miss this planet just as much as you are, when we leave for=

here as a gentile stream ripples over glistening river rocks while dragonfl=
ies dodge the current of the water. And now, for the first time, Tucson cou=
ld actually enjoy it visually as well as harmonically. <br>
> > > =

o enjoy this treasure than with you? No one. I only hope that after we leav=
e, this world will remain as pure as it is now. But there's more that I wan=
t to show you."<br>
